text: (bright upbeat music)

- Hi, I am Zwivhuya, a
cloud support associate
here in the AWS office in Cape Town.

Today, I'm going to show you
how to create a workspace image
in Amazon WorkSpaces.
This image can then be used to

launch multiple, identical
WorkSpaces for multiple users.

It's important to remember that
the workspace image feature

is not intended for picking
up individual workspaces.
The purpose of this feature,

is to create a standard
operating environment.
So, let me walk you though the process
of creating a workspace image.

After signing into the
AWS management console,
search for WorkSpaces and choose it.

Now launch your WorkSpaces
from our built-in bundles
by selecting launch WorkSpaces.

This WorkSpace can take
up to 20 minutes to create

so I've already created our
WorkSpaces for this demo.
Now, connect to the WorkSpace
that you want to create the image from
by using the WorkSpace client.

After you've connected, configure
the WorkSpace as desired.
I chose to install Amazon Chime.

As you can see, Amazon
Chime has been installed.

Then, I will disconnect
from the WorkSpaces.
Before creating a WorkSpace image,
be sure to review the requirements
for a successful image creation.
Next, I'll return to the WorkSpace console

and find the workspace that
I launched and customized
and then select it.

Note, that it is best practice
to reboot the WorkSpace

through the WorkSpace console
before creating the image.

This helps to make sure that
there are no hung service
and also that Windows is up to date
with the latest pages.
To demonstrate this, I'll choose actions.

Then, reboot WorkSpaces and
then confirm reboot WorkSpaces.
This can take a few minutes

and I'll wait for the status
to change available again.

You can check the status
change by refreshing the page.

After the WorkSpace is
available, select it.
Choose actions, create image,
and then click next.
Now, fill in the name and description.
I'll choose create image

and then wait for the image
creation process to finish.
Note that this can take up to 45 minutes.

A WorkSpace bundle is made
up of the software image
and the hardware profile.

You can create multiple
bundles with the same image

but with a different
hardware specifications.
I can check the WorkSpace image tab
to see whether my image is ready.

The status of the WorkSpaces
changes to available
when the image is ready.
I'll refresh

and as you can see, the
image is now available.
When the image is ready,

I can create a bundle from
it, by selecting the image

and then choosing create
bundle from the actions menu.
I simply fill in the name and description

and then choose the bundle
type and the volume size.
When the bundle is ready,
I can launch WorkSpaces for my users.
To do this, I'll select WorkSpaces
and then launch WorkSpaces,

choose my directory and
then select next step.
Select a user in the directory.
Choose add selected,
then choose next step.
Choose the bundle you created
and then select next step.

Choose running mode and
then select next step
and then launch WorkSpaces.
The WorkSpaces will be launched.

Thanks for watching and
happy cloud computing
from all of us here at AWS.
(bright upbeat music)
